SEARCH
Package database

Class Database

java.lang.Object
database.Database
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Database extends Object implements Serializable
The Database class represents the storage for various entities in the system.
See Also:

    • getAllPapers

      public void getAllPapers()
      Retrieves and prints the list of research papers based on the user's sorting preference. The user is prompted to choose the sorting order: 1. Sorted by date 2. Sorted by citations 3. Sorted by the number of pages The sorted list of papers is then printed to the console.

    • getPapersWithoutThis

      public Vector<ResearchPaper> getPapersWithoutThis(Researcher r)
      Retrieves a vector of research papers that do not have the specified researcher as an author.
      Parameters:
      The - researcher for whom papers are not to be included.
      Returns:
      A vector of research papers without the specified researcher as an author.

    • addLog

      public void addLog(User u, Log l)
      Adds a log entry for a user to the database. If the user already has existing logs, the new log entry is appended to the existing logs.
      Parameters:
      u - The user for whom the log entry is being added.
      l - The log entry to be added.

    • seeLogs

      public Vector<Log> seeLogs(User u)

    • isResearcher

      public Researcher isResearcher(User u)
      Checks if the specified user is associated with a researcher in the database. If a researcher with the specified user is found, the corresponding researcher object is returned; otherwise, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      u - The user for whom the association with a researcher is checked.
      Returns:
      The researcher associated with the user, or null if no association is found.
